pybayesx package

Submodules

pybayesx.binning module

pybayesx.binning.bin(x: Sequence, y: Sequence, channel: Sequence, n_bins: int, cellsize: float, x0: float = None, y0: float = None, n_channels: int = None, outfile: Path = None, mask: bool = False) → ndarray[Any, dtype[float64]]

Bin data given spatial coordinates and channel coordinates of events. If mask = True then instead bin passed on mask status.

Parameters

  • x (Sequence) – Sequence of x coordinates of events

  • y (Sequence) – Sequence of y coordinates of events, assumed to use the same units as x

  • channel (Sequence) – Sequence of channel of events. If mask is True then this value should be 1 for all masked spatial coordinates and 0 otherwise.

  • nbins (int) – The number of bins along each spatial axis

  • cellsize (float) – The size of a bin, in units matching x and y

  • x0 (float, optional) – Central (origin) point along x axis in data, defaults to None. If None then the midpoint of x is used.

  • y0 (float, optional) – See x0, defaults to None

  • n_channels (int, optional) – Number of possible channels, defaults to None. If None, then the maximum value of channel is used. If mask is True then a positive integer value is required.

  • outfile (Path, optional) – Path of file to export binned data to, defaults to None. If None export is skipped.

  • mask (bool, optional) – If True then the channel sequence is treated as a 1/0 (T/F) boolean definining masked regions. Defaults to False.

Raises

ValueError – If the value of max_chan is <=0 or (if in mask mode) if not set.

Returns

A 1D array of counts, of length n_bins*n_bins*chan_max. Nested as x_bin_index(y_bin_index)

Return type

np.ndarray[Any, np.dtype[np.float64]]

pybayesx.config module

pybayesx.input_data module

class pybayesx.input_data.Data(data: Union[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]], _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, _NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]])

Bases: ABC

abstract bin_and_export(n_bins: int, cellsize: float, outfile: Path, n_channels: int, **kwargs)
classmethod load_from_file(path: Path, file_type: Optional[str] = None) → Data

Try to intelligently handle events input from a number of file types.

Parameters

  • path (Path) – Path to events file

  • file_type (str, optional) – Override type detection by providing a file extension.

Raises

ValueError – If the file type cannot be recognised.

abstract classmethod load_from_fits(path: Path) → Data

class pybayesx.input_data.Events(data: Union[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]], _NestedSequence[_SupportsArray[dtype[Any]]], bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes, _NestedSequence[Union[bool, int, float, complex, str, bytes]]], background: bool)

Bases: Data

bin_and_export(n_bins: int, cellsize: float, outfile: Path, n_channels: int, **kwargs)
load_from_fits(path: Path, background: bool, x_key: str = 'X', y_key: str = 'Y', channel_key: str = 'PI', du_index=1, mode='evts', **kwargs) → Data

Load events from a fits file. The file will be converted to the text format used by BayesX.

Parameters

  • path (Path) – Path to events fits file

  • x_key (str, optional) – _description_, defaults to “X”

  • y_key (str, optional) – _description_, defaults to “Y”

  • channel_key (str, optional) – _description_, defaults to “PI”

  • du_index (int) – List index of data unit with events (0-indexed)

  • mode (str) – ‘evts’ for events, bg for background.

classmethod load_from_txt(path: Path, background: bool, nx: int, ny: int, nChannels: int, **kwargs) → Data

class pybayesx.model.Prior(property: Property, type_: int, param1: float, param2: float, true_value: Optional[float] = None, randomise: bool = False)

Bases: ABC

A prior as defined in BayesX.

This class is abstract and so cannot be directly instantiated. Subclasses must implement the sample() method.

Parameters

  • param1 (float) – Parameter for prior as specified in BayesX’s readme for prior type.

  • param1 – See param1.

  • true_value (float, optional) – True value of prior

export(fixed=False) → str

Return prior as defined.

Parameters

fixed (bool, optional) – Export true value as delta prior, defaults to False

Raises

AttributeError – When attempting to export fixed prior without setting true value

Returns

String describing prior as used in BAYES-X infile.

Return type

str

abstract sample() → float

Randomly select a value from prior, using the same methods as in BayesX.

Returns

Random value selected from prior.

Return type

float
